p.i: Annotations allow you to add context information to the time series data. For example, if you have a chart that shows some app behaviour over the last week, you can add an event annotation that flags the changes or restarts. It is basically an additional search running in parallel and looking for related events. Annotations are supported for charts, column charts, and area charts. In order to create an event annotation you have to edit xml.

html.code: index=_audit action=search result_count="*" | timechart avg(total_run_time) as avgRunTime
html.p: The additional annotation search used here looks like this: index=_internal (log_level="WARN" OR log_level="ERROR") | fields _time log_level thread_name | eval annotation_label = thread_name | eval annotation_category = log_level

panel.title: Average Search Run Time with WARN/ERROR event annotations

search.query: index=_audit action=search result_count="*" | timechart avg(total_run_time) as avgRunTime
index=_internal (log_level="WARN" OR log_level="ERROR") | fields _time log_level thread_name | eval annotation_label = thread_name | eval annotation_category = log_level
